name: Invention of Glasses/Spectacles
description: The first wearable eyeglasses were invented in Italy.

name: Suspected Invention of the Thermometer
description: Galileo Galilei invented a rudimentary water thermoscope

name: Identification of Germ Theory
description: Athanasius Kircher attributes infectious disease to microscopic pathogens, inventing the germ theory of disease.

name: First Vaccine
description: Edward Jenner developed the first vaccine for smallpox

name: Invention of Anesthesia
description: William T.G. Morton successfully demonstrated the use of ether as an anesthetic

name: First open heart surgery
description: Axel Cappelen performed the first surgery on the heart itself

name: Creation of Insulin
description: Frederick Banting and Charles Best discovered insulin for treating diabetes

name: First use of the Defibrillator on a human
description: Claude Beck used a Defibrillator successfully on a human

name: First trial of purpose made Chemotherapy drug
description: The first clinical trial of 'mustine' or chlormethine was performed

name: First organ transplant
description: Joseph Murray performed the first successful kidney transplant between identical twins

name: Invention of MRI
description: Paul C. Lauterbur developed magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)

name: First Microplastic Discovery
description: Scientists first discover plastic particles in ocean waters, marking the beginning of microplastic awareness.

name: Microplastic Term Coined
description: First recorded usage of the term microplastic in scientific literature.

name: Discovery that CRISPR can be used for editing genomes
description: Jennifer Doudna and Emmanuelle Charpentier identified CRISPR gene editing potential

name: First known case of Covid-19
description: The first known case of COVID-19 was identified in Wuhan, China

name: First human/animal transplant
description: Christiaan Barnard performed the first human-to-human heart transplant
